info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN BUTLER, WARREN, NORTHWESTERN CLINTON, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hunter, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Mason, Xenia, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Wilmington, Monroe, Franklin, Bellbrook, Carlisle, Waynesville, Jamestown, Four Bridges, Hunter, Wilberforce, South Lebanon, New Jasper, Clarksville and Harveysburg. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 26 and 56. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 26 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
